skill.name: subagent-driven-development
skill.description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.summary: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: This skill contains prompt templates for coordinating AI subagents during software development. The static scanner flagged patterns like 'backtick execution' and 'weak cryptographic algorithm' that are actually just markdown code blocks and example commands in documentation, not executable code. No actual security risks identified.

content.user_title: Execute development plans with AI subagents and reviews
content.value_statement: Break down complex development plans into manageable tasks. Each task gets a fresh AI subagent that implements, tests, and undergoes two-stage review for spec compliance and code quality.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches fresh subagents for each independent task
Performs two-stage review: spec compliance then code quality
Integrates with TodoWrite for task tracking
Provides prompt templates for implementer and reviewer roles
limitations: Requires independent tasks that can be executed sequentially
Needs existing implementation plan from writing-plans skill
Consumes more AI calls due to review process

use_cases.title: Implement multi-task feature plans
use_cases.description: Break down feature implementation into discrete tasks, each handled by dedicated AI subagents with built-in quality reviews.

use_cases.title: Ensure spec compliance in development
use_cases.description: Use two-stage review process to catch spec deviations early and maintain code quality standards across implementations.

use_cases.title: Get code review without context switching
use_cases.description: Stay in your session while AI subagents handle implementation and provide objective code reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Basic implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using Subagent-Driven Development to implement this plan. Task 1: Create user authentication endpoint with JWT tokens.

prompt_templates.title: Complex multi-task plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute this plan using subagent-driven-development: [attach plan.md] with 5 tasks including API, database, and frontend changes.

prompt_templates.title: With specific constraints
prompt_templates.prompt: Use subagent-driven-development for this plan. Ensure all subagents follow TDD and maintain 90% test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Review-focused execution
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement using subagent-driven-development with extra attention to code quality reviews. Flag any architectural concerns.

output_examples.input: Implement user authentication system with 3 tasks
output: Task 1: JWT token endpoint - ‚úÖ Implemented with 95% test coverage
Task 2: User registration flow - ‚úÖ Spec compliant, code approved
Task 3: Password reset feature - ‚úÖ Quality review passed
Final review: All tasks complete, ready to merge

output_examples.input: Add payment processing with strict compliance
output: Task 1: Payment API integration - ‚ùå Missing webhook handling
Fixed: Added webhook endpoint and tests
Task 2: Transaction logging - ‚úÖ Compliant with audit requirements

best_practices: Always extract full task text upfront to avoid file reading overhead
Answer subagent questions completely before they begin implementation
Never skip spec compliance review - it catches over/under-building early
anti_patterns: Do not dispatch multiple implementers in parallel - causes conflicts
Never let subagents read plan files directly - provide extracted text
Do not proceed to code quality review before spec compliance passes

faq.question: How does this differ from Executing Plans?
faq.answer: Subagent-driven-development stays in the same session with fresh subagents per task, while Executing Plans uses parallel sessions.

faq.question: Why two review stages?
faq.answer: Spec compliance ensures you built the right thing, code quality ensures you built it right. Spec review comes first to avoid wasting time on incorrect implementations.

faq.question: Can I skip reviews to save time?
faq.answer: No - reviews catch issues early when they're cheaper to fix. Skipping reviews defeats the purpose of quality assurance.

faq.question: What if a subagent fails a task?
faq.answer: Dispatch a fix subagent with specific instructions about what went wrong. Don't try to fix manually to avoid context pollution.

faq.question: How many tasks can I include?
faq.answer: As many as needed, but ensure they're independent. The skill processes them sequentially with reviews after each.

faq.question: Does this work with any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes - the skill is language-agnostic. Subagents adapt to your project's language and frameworks.
